remarks: The span of a vector is either an atom or the zero subspace. (Contributed by NM, 15-Mar-2015.)
statement:
lsator0sp.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lsator0sp.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lsator0sp.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lsator0sp.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` W ) $.
isator0sp.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
isator0sp.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lsator0sp $p |- ( ph -> ( ( N ` { X } ) e. A \/ ( N ` { X } ) = { .0. } ) ) $.
